# Bug Report Template for Azure DevOps

Copy-paste this template when logging bugs in Azure DevOps Work Items.

---

## üêõ Bug Report Template

**Title**: [Short, descriptive title - e.g., "Login fails with valid credentials"]

### üìã Bug Details

**Bug ID**: [Will be auto-generated by Azure DevOps]
**Reported By**: [Your name]
**Date Reported**: [YYYY-MM-DD]
**Severity**: [Critical / High / Medium / Low]
**Priority**: [P0 / P1 / P2 / P3]
**Status**: [New / Active / Resolved / Closed]

---

### üéØ Environment

- **OS**: [e.g., Windows 11, macOS Ventura]
- **Browser**: [e.g., Chrome 120, Firefox 121]
- **Device**: [e.g., Desktop, iPhone 14, Samsung Galaxy S23]
- **Frontend URL**: http://localhost:3000
- **Backend URL**: http://localhost:5000
- **Database**: PostgreSQL

---

### üìù Description

[Clear, concise description of the bug]

**Example**:
When attempting to log in with valid credentials (test@ootd.com / Test1234), the login button becomes disabled but no redirect occurs. User remains on login page indefinitely.

---

### üîÑ Steps to Reproduce

1. Navigate to http://localhost:3000/login
2. Enter email: test@ootd.com
3. Enter password: Test1234
4. Click "◊î◊™◊ó◊ë◊®◊ï◊™" (Login) button
5. Observe behavior

---

### ‚úÖ Expected Behavior

[What should happen]

**Example**:
- Login button should show loading state
- User should be authenticated
- Redirect to home page (/)
- User name should appear in header
- "◊î◊ê◊®◊ï◊ü ◊©◊ú◊ô" link should be visible in navigation

---

### ‚ùå Actual Behavior

[What actually happens]

**Example**:
- Login button becomes disabled
- No loading indicator appears
- Page does not redirect
- User stays on /login
- No error message displayed
- Console shows: `POST http://localhost:5000/api/auth/login 401 (Unauthorized)`

---

### üì∏ Screenshots / Videos

[Attach screenshots or screen recordings showing the bug]

**How to attach in Azure DevOps**:
1. Click "Attach files" button
2. Upload screenshot/video
3. Reference in description: `See attachment: bug-screenshot.png`

**Example attachments**:
- `login-error-screenshot.png`
- `console-error.png`
- `network-tab-recording.mp4`

### üí° Possible Cause / Root Cause

[If known, describe what might be causing the bug]

**Example**:
Backend authentication middleware may not be properly validating JWT tokens. Possible issue in `/backend/middleware/auth.js`.

---

### üõ†Ô∏è Suggested Fix

[If you have ideas on how to fix it]

**Example**:
1. Check if bcrypt is correctly comparing passwords in authController.js
2. Verify JWT_SECRET is properly loaded from .env
3. Ensure database user exists with correct password hash

- Found In: `testing`, `production`, `development`

### ‚úã Blocking

**Is this bug blocking other work?**: [Yes / No]
**Blocks**: [List blocked work items or features]

---

## üìä Severity & Priority Guidelines

### Severity Levels:
- **Critical**: App crashes, data loss, security vulnerability
- **High**: Major feature broken, no workaround
- **Medium**: Feature partially broken, workaround exists
- **Low**: Minor issue, cosmetic, edge case

### Priority Levels:
- **P0**: Fix immediately (production down)
- **P1**: Fix in current sprint
- **P2**: Fix in next sprint
- **P3**: Fix when time allows

---

## üéØ Example Filled Bug Report

**Title**: Login Button Disabled After Invalid Credentials

### Bug Details
- **Severity**: Medium
- **Priority**: P2
- **Status**: New

### Environment
- **OS**: Windows 11
- **Browser**: Chrome 120.0.6099.130
- **Device**: Desktop (1920x1080)

### Description
After entering incorrect login credentials and receiving an error, the login button remains disabled and cannot be clicked again without refreshing the page.

### Steps to Reproduce
1. Go to /login
2. Enter wrong email: wrong@test.com
3. Enter wrong password: wrongpass
4. Click login
5. See error message
6. Try to login again with correct credentials
7. Notice button is still disabled

### Expected Behavior
- Error message should display
- Form should reset to allow retry
- Login button should be re-enabled

### Actual Behavior
- Error message displays correctly
- Form fields are editable
- Login button stays disabled
- Must refresh page to try again

### Console Logs
```
No console errors
Button state: disabled="true"
```

### Impact
- **User Impact**: Users must refresh page to retry login (poor UX)
- **Business Impact**: Low - workaround is simple refresh

### Possible Cause
Form submission handler not re-enabling button after error response

### Suggested Fix
In Login.jsx, ensure button is re-enabled in catch block:
```javascript
.catch((error) => {
  setError(error.message);
  setIsLoading(false); // This line may be missing
});
```

### Labels
- Component: `frontend`, `authentication`
- Type: `bug`, `ui`
- Priority: `P2`

---

## üìù Quick Copy Templates

### Critical Bug
```
Title: [CRITICAL] [Feature] is completely broken

Severity: Critical
Priority: P0

Description: [Feature] is not working at all, blocking all users.

Steps: [1, 2, 3]
Expected: [Should work]
Actual: [Doesn't work, throws error]

Console: [Error messages]
Impact: Blocks all users from [critical functionality]
```

### UI Bug
```
Title: [UI] Button misaligned on mobile

Severity: Low
Priority: P3

Description: "Add Item" button is cut off on iPhone screens.

Steps:
1. Open app on mobile (375px width)
2. Navigate to /closet
3. Observe button

Expected: Button fully visible
Actual: Button text truncated

Screenshot: [attached]
```

---

**Remember**: Good bug reports help developers fix issues faster! Include as much detail as possible. üéØ
